file_content.text: That's it. Got it set for as big a non-lethal burst as we can manage.
Should be?
Hard to come up with a one-size-fits-all solution. Lot of guesswork involved. Wish there was some way we could do a test run.
Should be enough to zap anyone in range into a nice, long, involuntary nap.
They've got to be closing in.
Then come on. We need to be shielded.
Okay. We should wait until they're good and close.
I had to kill those Jedi.
I spared those Jedi.
I thought we'd never meet again. It's nice to be wrong.
[Flirt] It's good to see you.
Two more of your team are dead, by the way. You have yourself to thank for that.
The dead Jedi are your fault.
I wasn't sure when I'd run into you again. Not the greatest circumstances, but still.
[Flirt] It's good to see you.
I saved two of your Jedi, by the way. Shocked them instead of killing them.
You really messed up here.
However this pans out, it's been good to work with you again.
Glad we worked together.
Same here. Beats how I imagined our next meeting--aside from the part where we're fighting two armies possessed by a crazy Sith Lord.
No offense.
I came across two of your team, Theron.
And?
They had to be dealt with. You know that.
Two more. And that guy you were working with. Lana's asset. I haven't seen him around. He's probably dead, too.
Like you had to "deal with" Agent Kovach. Unbelievable.
The Sixth Line, Kovach... just about everyone I know on Ziost except for you and Lana, gone.
I gave them a shock. When I left, they were still out.
And here I was sure they'd end up like Kovach. Thanks--really.
Good, thanks. Let's just hope that they don't end up in the Emperor's control soon as they wake up.
Despite all the awfulness on Yavin Four, it did have its moments.
You go from executing Kovach for no great reason to sentimental. Guess I don't get you like I thought I did.
Maybe next time the lives of an entire world won't be in danger--but, yeah, feeling's mutual.
Sure, aside from watching you murder Kovach for no good reason, it's been great.
Well, Kovach aside, but, you know, I get it. No way could I ever work with him after that.
What a disaster.
It has been, hasn't it? All things considered, anyway.
The Sixth Line, Kovach--just kill them all, right? Who cares that they're on your side.
You're not wrong, though. I have made a mess of things.
Damn it. I hoped there might be a way--save them, help them somehow.
I've really gone and made a mess of things.
Yes--you have.
Here they come. I sure hope this works....
I appreciate it.
You'd better. It's your fault they're here in the first place.
Yeah. Thanks for reminding me.
Okay, here comes the puppet brigade. Fingers crossed....
This one was closest, took the biggest hit.
Still alive. We did it!
Let's just hope we got all of them. We should call Lana now, see if she has a plan for what's next.
I have a better idea.
Master Surro. No.
Watching you believe you had a chance, it's amused me. Now this whole charade is pathetic.
Now, how do you wish to die? In combat or on your knees?
Go away, little Sith.
This has nothing to do with your friends. This is you and I.
No matter how powerful you are, I'll never fall to you.
You won't win.
Fight him, Master Surro!
All right, "Emperor". Let's get this over with.
So be it. [Attack]
Hey, Master Surro--this would be a good time to come on out.
I know you're in there, Jedi. Your body is yours to control. Take it from him!
Master Surro, I know you're in there. Remember your training. You must take control.
Your words are as desperate as they are useless. And they will be your last.
Not to brag, but you're going to have your work cut out for you. Okay, I bragged.
I'm not worried.
I hope you're not expecting an easy fight.
I won't give up.
Confident--to the end.
